intro: Cynoglossum montanum var. alpinum, commonly known as alpine tongue grass, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps and other mountainous areas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its blooming period usually occurs in late summer, adding vibrant color to mountainous landscapes.
